Package net.jxta.impl.endpoint.netty

Interface Summary
AddressTranslator Describes a facility to convert between a SocketAddress and a JXTA EndpointAddress.
MessageArrivalListener The interface which is used for dispatching the messages and connection related information out of the Netty channel pipeline to the JXTA environment.
NettyChannelRegistry Simple notification interface for when a new channel is created and fully established (i.e.
TransportClientComponent  
TransportComponent Represents a (potentially optional) component of a transport implementation, which can be started and stopped.
TransportServerComponent  
 

Class Summary
ConnectionRejector Simple channel handler which will immediately close all accepted connections until an atomic boolean is flipped from false to true.
InetSocketAddressTranslator Socket address translator for traditional java InetSocketAddress instances, both IPv6 and IPv4.
JxtaMessageDecoder Decodes JXTA message frames from their network form into logical Message objects, and passes them upstream.
JxtaMessageEncoder Encodes a Message instance into the corresponding wire header and body, using the default encoding for WireFormatMessageFactory.
JxtaProtocolHandler Implementation of the JXTA TCP/IP choreography protocol as specified in https://jxta-spec.dev.java.net/nonav/JXTAProtocols.html#trans-tcpipt Section 7.1 of the JXTA v2.0 Protocols Specification.
MessageDispatchHandler The terminal upstream listener, which takes decoded messages (either WelcomeMessage or Message) and passes this information up to the MessageArrivalListener - typically, the NettyMessenger for this connection.
NettyMessenger Netty channel based messenger implementation.
NettyTransport JBoss Netty based endpoint transport.
NettyTransportChannelPipelineFactory  
NettyTransportClient Client side of a netty based transport.
NettyTransportServer The server side of a netty based transport.
NullTransportClientComponent A "null object" implementation of the TransportClientComponent implementation, used when the client end of a transport is disabled by the configuration.
NullTransportComponent Basic "null object" implementation of the transport component, intended for extension by more specific transport component types, to cleanly disable the expected functionality within the transport.
NullTransportServerComponent Basic "null object" implementation of the TransportServerComponent interface, intended to be used to cleanly disable the server functionality in a transport.
SerializedMessage Holds the serialized components of a message to be transmitted in the format dictated by Section 7.1 "TCP/IP Message Transport" of the JXTA v2.0 protocols specification.
